page.title: 14OAKFIELD C.E. PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: Our school is{Oakfield C.E. (Aided) {Primary School}which is in the parish of, and has connections with St John's Church. As well as being a{Church School,}we serve a local catchment area and currently have{174 pupils,}boys and girls aged from rising 5 to 9 years, in{six classes}with six teachers and a head teacher. The old part of the school, now a hall, kitchen and offices, was built in 1878. Five classrooms were added in 1970 and a mobile classroom in 1973. There is one playground and many grassy areas where pets are housed. There is a small area for nature studies which contains a wide variety of trees and a spring fed pond. There are no playing fields so we travel by Authority bus to Little Appley field 1 km away.
